entry.et: Middle English, from Old English bendan; akin to Old English bend fetter band

def.dt: :to constrain or strain to tension by curving bend a bow
:to turn or force from straight or even to curved or angular
:to force from a proper shape
:to force back to an original straight or even condition
:fasten bend a sail to its yard
:to cause to turn from a straight course :deflect
:to guide or turn toward :direct
:incline dispose
:to adapt to one's purpose :distort bend the rules
:to direct strenuously or with interest :apply bent himself to the task
:to make submissive :subdue
:to curve out of a straight line or position
:to incline the body in token of submission
:to apply oneself vigorously bending to their work
:incline tend
:compromise 2
:to talk to someone at length
:to make extreme efforts
:the act or process of bending :the state of being bent
:something that is bent: as
:a curved part of a path (as of a stream or road)
:wale 2 usually used in plural

sin.spl: plural but sing or plural in constr

def.dt: :the painful manifestations (as joint pain) of decompression sickness
:decompression sickness usually used with the
:mad crazy

entry.et: Middle English, from Middle French bende, of Germanic origin; akin to Old High German binta, bant band band

def.dt: :a diagonal band that runs from the dexter chief to the sinister base on a heraldic shield compare bend sinister
def.set: Middle English, band, from Old English bend fetter band
def.dt: :a knot by which one rope is fastened to another or to some object
city cen Oregon on the Deschutes pop 52,029
:a diagonal band that runs from the sinister chief to the dexter base on a heraldic shield

entry.et: probably from obsolete English carrick carrack, from Middle English carrake, carryk

def.dt: :a knot used to join the ends of two large ropes see knot illustration
:a knot made by passing the end twice round a spar or through a ring and then back under both turns see knot illustration
:a bend or hitch used for temporarily fastening a rope to the bight of another rope or to an eye see knot illustration
area W Texas in large bend of the Rio Grande; partly included in Big Bend National Park
section of Columbia River E cen Washington
city N Indiana NW of Fort Wayne pop 107,789
